question: The formation of which inflammatory molecule is regulated by MAP3K8 (TPL2)?
ideal_answer: MAP3K8 (Tpl2) regulates the formation of inflammatory molecule IL-1β

snippets.text: Tpl2(-/-) macrophages have abrogated TNF production but overproduce IL-12 in response to TLR ligands.
At this time, Cot/tpl2(-/-) mice showed significantly reduced NGF, TNFα, and prostaglandin E(2) levels compared with WT littermates.

We identified MAP3K8 as a target gene of Hypoxia Induced Factor (HIF), a transcription factor controlled by oxygen tension, upstream of the p38/MAPK pathway.

Mice lacking MAP3K8 had similar bodyweight gain as WT mice, yet displayed lower mRNA expression levels of IL-1β, IL-6 and CXCL1 in adipose tissue in response to the HFD as compared to WT animals.
In contrast to the cell-type- and receptor-specific regulation of TNF, we found that Tpl2 is essential for IL-1beta production from both macrophages and dendritic cells.
